required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Single-Ascending Doses of DS-6016a in Healthy Japanese Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: Single-Ascending Dose Phase 1 Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics of DS-6016a After Subcutaneous Injection in Healthy Japanese Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: This study will assess the safety, tolerability, and pharmacokinetics of DS-6016a after subcutaneous injection in healthy Japanese participants.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Reporting Treatment-emergent Adverse Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 through end of study, up to 8 weeks post-dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic Parameter of Maximum (Peak) Observed Serum Concentration (Cmax) of Plasma DS-6016a Following Subcutaneous Administration of DS-6016a
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (pre-dose, 2 and 8 hours after the start of administration), Day 2 (24 and 36 hours after the start of administration), Day 3, Day 4, Day 5, Day 6, Day 7, Day 8, Day 9, Day 10, Day 12, Day 15, Day 18, Day 22, Day 29, Day 36, Day 43, Day 57

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic Parameter of Time to Reach Maximum Concentration (Tmax) of Plasma DS-6016a Following Subcutaneous Administration of DS-6016a
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (pre-dose, 2 and 8 hours after the start of administration), Day 2 (24 and 36 hours after the start of administration), Day 3, Day 4, Day 5, Day 6, Day 7, Day 8, Day 9, Day 10, Day 12, Day 15, Day 18, Day 22, Day 29, Day 36, Day 43, Day 57

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic Parameter of Area Under the Concentration-time Curve of Plasma DS-6016a Following Subcutaneous Administration of DS-6016a
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (pre-dose, 2 and 8 hours after the start of administration), Day 2 (24 and 36 hours after the start of administration), Day 3, Day 4, Day 5, Day 6, Day 7, Day 8, Day 9, Day 10, Day 12, Day 15, Day 18, Day 22, Day 29, Day 36, Day 43, Day 57
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the concentration-time curve from time 0 to last measurable time point (AUClast), time 0 to 336h (AUC336h), and time 0 to infinity (AUCinf) will be assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic Parameter of Total Clearance (CL/F) of Plasma DS-6016a Following Subcutaneous Administration of DS-6016a
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (pre-dose, 2 and 8 hours after the start of administration), Day 2 (24 and 36 hours after the start of administration), Day 3, Day 4, Day 5, Day 6, Day 7, Day 8, Day 9, Day 10, Day 12, Day 15, Day 18, Day 22, Day 29, Day 36, Day 43, Day 57

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic Parameter of Terminal elimination half-life (t1/2) of Plasma DS-6016a Following Subcutaneous Administration of DS-6016a
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (pre-dose, 2 and 8 hours after the start of administration), Day 2 (24 and 36 hours after the start of administration), Day 3, Day 4, Day 5, Day 6, Day 7, Day 8, Day 9, Day 10, Day 12, Day 15, Day 18, Day 22, Day 29, Day 36, Day 43, Day 57

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic Parameter of Volume of Distribution (Vz/F) of Plasma DS-6016a Following Subcutaneous Administration of DS-6016a
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (pre-dose, 2 and 8 hours after the start of administration), Day 2 (24 and 36 hours after the start of administration), Day 3, Day 4, Day 5, Day 6, Day 7, Day 8, Day 9, Day 10, Day 12, Day 15, Day 18, Day 22, Day 29, Day 36, Day 43, Day 57

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Who Are Anti-Drug Antibody (ADA)-Positive (Baseline and Post-Baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: The immunogenicity of DS-6016a will be assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Who Have Treatment-emergent ADAs
secondary_outcome.description: The immunogenicity of DS-6016a will be assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Who Have Anti-host Cell Protein (HCP) Antibodies
secondary_outcome.description: The immunogenicity of DS-6016a will be assessed.

arm_group.description: Participants will be randomized to receive a single, subcutaneous injection of DS-6016a.
Participants will be randomized to receive a single, subcutaneous injection of DS-6016a.
Participants will be randomized to receive a single, subcutaneous injection of DS-6016a.
Participants will be randomized to receive a single, subcutaneous injection of DS-6016a.
Participants will be randomized to receive a single, subcutaneous injection of DS-6016a.
Participants will be randomized to receive a single, subcutaneous injection of DS-6016a.
Participants will be randomized to receive a single, subcutaneous injection of placebo.

intervention.description: DS-6016a will be administered as a single subcutaneous injection into the upper arm, upper part of the thigh, or abdominal wall
Placebo will be administered as a single subcutaneous injection into the upper arm, upper part of the thigh, or abdominal wall

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Japanese healthy male subjects.
- Age ≥20 and ≤45 years upon providing informed consent.
- Body mass index (BMI) ≥18.5 and <25.0 kg/m^2 at screening.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have a history of hypersensitivity to any drugs or substances, or being idiosyncratic (eg, having penicillin allergy)
- Have alcohol or drug dependence, etc.

patient_data.ipd_description: De-identified individual participant data (IPD) and applicable supporting clinical trial documents may be available upon request at https://vivli.org/. In cases where clinical trial data and supporting documents are provided pursuant to our company policies and procedures, Daiichi Sankyo will continue to protect the privacy of our clinical trial participants. Details on data sharing criteria and the procedure for requesting access can be found at this web address: https://vivli.org/ourmember/daiichi-sankyo/
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Studies for which the medicine and indication have received European Union (EU) and United States (US), and/or Japan (JP) marketing approval on or after 01 January 2014 or by the US or EU or JP Health Authorities when regulatory submissions in all regions are not planned and after the primary study results have been accepted for publication.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Formal request from qualified scientific and medical researchers on IPD and clinical study documents from clinical trials supporting products submitted and licensed in the United States, the European Union and/or Japan from 01 January 2014 and beyond for the purpose of conducting legitimate research. This must be consistent with the principle of safeguarding study participants' privacy and consistent with provision of informed consent.
